class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. UAF occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. UAF occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] => `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` => `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<span class="line"><!---->In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] =&gt; `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` =&gt; `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<!----></span><br><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142<!----></a><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=168<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=168"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=168<!----></a><br>[3]<span class="line"><!---->[3]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc;l=712<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc;l=712"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc;l=712<!----></a><br><br>=================================================================<span 0x5615ba00620c bp 0x7ffe74afa190 sp 0x7ffe74afa188<span class="line"><!---->==137709==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x61e000082880 at pc 0x5615ba00620c bp 0x7ffe74afa190 sp 0x7ffe74afa188<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x61e000082880 thread T0 (chrome)<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x61e000082880 thread T0 (chrome)<!----></span><br>    #0 0x5615ba00620b in GetNavigationObserverManager chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc:712:21<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x5615ba00620b in GetNavigationObserverManager chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc:712:21<!----></span><br>    #1 0x5615ba00620b in safe_browsing::DownloadProtectionService::AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest(content::WebContents*, GURL const&, GURL const&, SessionID, bool, safe_browsing::ClientDownloadRequest*) chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc:586:7<span class="line"><!---->    #1 0x5615ba00620b in safe_browsing::DownloadProtectionService::AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest(content::WebContents*, GURL const&amp;, GURL const&amp;, SessionID, bool, safe_browsing::ClientDownloadRequest*) chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc:205:13<span class="line"><!---->    #2 0x5615ba045c21 in safe_browsing::PPAPIDownloadRequest::SendRequest() The fix for this is to<span class="line"><!---->checking the allowlist, we end up with a UaF.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/65e7f7c5442eb4860ddd647d98936cacfeec2d1b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/65e7f7c5442eb4860ddd647d98936cacfeec2d1b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/65e7f7c5442eb4860ddd647d98936cacfeec2d1b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>65e7f7c5442eb4860ddd647d98936cacfeec2d1b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/65e7f7c5442eb4860ddd647d98936cacfeec2d1b"><!---->65e7f7c5442eb4860ddd647d98936cacfeec2d1b<!----></a><br>Author: Daniel Rubery <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daniel Rubery &lt;<!----></span>drubery@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/drubery@chromium.org"><!---->drubery@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Oct 06 15:25:10 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Oct 06 15:25:10 2021<!----></span><br><br>[M90-LTS] Observe WebContents in PPAPIDownloadRequest<span class="line"><!---->[M90-LTS] Observe WebContents in PPAPIDownloadRequest<!----></span><br><br>If the WebContents is destroyed while the PPAPIDownloadRequest is<span class="line"><!---->If the WebContents is destroyed while the PPAPIDownloadRequest is<!----></span><br>checking the allowlist, we end up with a UaF. The fix for this is to<span class="line"><!---->checking the allowlist, we end up with a UaF. The fix for this is to<!----></span><br>observe the WebContents and cancel the request.<span class="line"><!---->observe the WebContents and cancel the request.<!----></span><br><br>M90 merge notes:<span class="line"><!---->M90 merge notes:<!----></span><br>  Conflicting lines for checking HasUserGesture().<span class="line"><!---->  Conflicting lines for checking HasUserGesture().<!----></span><br>  Decided to keep the web_contents nullity check since<span class="line"><!---->  Decided to keep the web_contents nullity check since<!----></span><br>  the comments say it can be null in tests.<span class="line"><!---->  the comments say it can be null in tests.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>e7d560979f89705ea2844f9f64b5c7a598a03f2b<a class="undefined" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1245578%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D4000" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1245578%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D4000%252526ust%25253D1703410025816856%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw1LQpTOS4PnSGPZx17To-be%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

mojom.js file: `python copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/ASAN/gen/` and start a server at floder of poc.html & test.html : `python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605`<span class="line"><!---->2. copy the UAF occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. UAF occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] => `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` => `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<span class="line"><!---->In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] =&gt; `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` =&gt; `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<!----></span><br><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142<a class="undefined" redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==137709==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->==137709==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? The fix for this is to<span class="line"><!---->checking the allowlist, we end up with a UaF. If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

          width: 100%;

          margin: auto;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

UAF occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. UAF occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] => `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` => `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<span class="line"><!---->In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] =&gt; `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` =&gt; `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<!----></span><br><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142<a class="undefined"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/92.0.4515.107 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. download asan-linux-release-917083.zip and unzip chrome<span class="line"><!---->1. download asan-linux-release-917083.zip and unzip chrome<!----></span><br>2. copy the mojom.js file: `python copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/ASAN/gen/` and start a server at floder of poc.html & test.html : `python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605`<span class="line"><!---->2. copy the mojom.js file: `python copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/ASAN/gen/` and start a server at floder of poc.html &amp; test.html : `python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605`<!----></span><br>3. ./asan-linux-release-917083/chrome  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist <span class="line"><!---->3. ./asan-linux-release-917083/chrome  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. UAF occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. UAF occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] => `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` => `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<span class="line"><!---->In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] =&gt; `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` =&gt; `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<!----></span><br><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=142<!----></a><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=168<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=168"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/ppapi_download_request.cc;l=168<!----></a><br>[3]<span class="line"><!---->[3]<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc;l=712<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc;l=712"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc;l=712<!----></a><br><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==137709==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x61e000082880 at pc 0x5615ba00620c bp 0x7ffe74afa190 sp 0x7ffe74afa188<span class="line"><!---->==137709==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x61e000082880 at pc 0x5615ba00620c bp 0x7ffe74afa190 sp 0x7ffe74afa188<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x61e000082880 thread T0 (chrome)<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x61e000082880 thread T0 (chrome)<!----></span><br>    #0 0x5615ba00620b in GetNavigationObserverManager chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc:712:21<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x5615ba00620b in GetNavigationObserverManager chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/download_protection_service.cc:712:21<!----></span><br>    #1 0x5615ba00620b in safe_browsing::DownloadProtectionService::AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest(content::WebContents*, GURL const&, GURL const&, SessionID, bool, safe_browsing::ClientDownloadRequest*) The fix for this is to<span class="line"><!---->checking the allowlist, we end up with a UaF. The fix for this is to<!----></span><br>observe the WebContents and cancel the request.<span class="line"><!---->observe the WebContents and cancel the request.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>e7d560979f89705ea2844f9f64b5c7a598a03f2b<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;

        }

          margin-top: 1em;
        }

          margin-top: 40px;

      </style>

UAF occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. UAF occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] => `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` => `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<span class="line"><!---->In function PPAPIDownloadRequest::CheckAllowlistsOnIOThread()[1], UIThreadTaskRunner will post a task which will call AllowlistCheckComplete()[2]. AllowlistCheckComplete will then call function like this: `SendRequest`[2] =&gt; `AddReferrerChainToPPAPIClientDownloadRequest` =&gt; `GetNavigationObserverManager`[3].And GetNavigationObserverManager will use `web_contents` without check, if we could delete `web_contents` before the posted taks is called, UAF occurs.<!----></span><br><br>[1]<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
